      Synthesis, X-ray Structures, and Fluorescent Properties of Coordination Networks Constructed from 2-(2-Pyridinyl-benzimidazolyl) Acetic Anion
      Wang, Zuo-Wei; Ji, Chang-Chun; Li, Jing; Guo, Zi-Jian; Li, Yi-Zhi; Zheng, He-Gen
      Crystal Growth & Design (2009), 9 (1), 475-482CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
      Four new metal coordination polymers, [Cd(pybma)2]n (1), [Zn(pybma)(C2O4)0.5·0.5H2O]n (2), [Co(pybma)(C2O4)0.5]n (3), and [Zn3(pybma)2(HBTC)2(H2O)4]n (4) [pybma = (2-(2-pyridinyl)benzimidazol-1-yl)acetate; H3BTC = 1,3,5-benzenetricarboxylate], were synthesized under hydrothermal conditions and structurally characterized by element analyses, IR spectroscopy, and single-crystal x-ray diffraction analyses. Has a 1-dimensional (1D) chain structure, which contains two kinds of rings. Has a two-dimensional (2D) metal-org. framework and can be seen as the unity of two parallel double-stranded helixes, in which the helixes are bridged by oxalate ligands. Has a 2-dimensional framework built from 1-dimensional chains and ox bridges. Has 2-dimensional layer framework which is assembled into a three-dimensional (3D) framework with two kinds of channels. Polymers 1, 2, and 4 exhibit obvious fluorescent emissions in the solid state at room temp.; no fluorescent emission is obsd. in polymer 3.

      A Series of Four-Connected Entangled Metal-Organic Frameworks Assembled from Pamoic Acid and Pyridine-Containing Ligands: Interpenetrating, Self-Penetrating, and Supramolecular Isomerism
      Wang, Suna; Yun, Ruirui; Peng, Yanqiang; Zhang, Qingfu; Lu, Jing; Dou, Jianmin; Bai, Junfeng; Li, Dacheng; Wang, Daqi
      Crystal Growth & Design (2012), 12 (1), 79-92CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
      Five novel compds., {[Ni(PA)(bpe)(H2O)2]·DMF}n (1), {[Zn(PA)(bpe)]·DMF}n (2), {[Zn(PA)(bpe)]·2DMF·CH3OH}n (3), {[Cd2(PA)2(bpe)2(H2O)]·3.5H2O}n (4), {[Ni2(PA)2(bpp)2(H2O)3]·2DMF}n (5), based on pamoic acid (H2PA) (bpe = 1,2-bis(4-pyridyl)ethane, bpp = 1,3-bis(4-pyridyl)propane) were synthesized. In such a system, both the PA2- anion ligand and dipyridyl ligands act as bipodal linkers, connecting the metal centers in square or tetrahedral geometries into 4-connected topologies with different entangled modes: 3-fold interpenetrating CdSO4 net (65.8) (1), roto-translational [2 + 2] interpenetrating diamond pseudosupramol. isomers (2 and 3), 3-fold interpenetrating (6.74.8)(64.7.8) (4) and (6.85)(64.82) net with both 2-fold interpenetrating and self-penetrating characters (5), resp. The formation of unique penetrating frameworks was studied. Gas adsorption and photoluminescent properties of the compds. also were explored.

      10a
      Supramolecular chemistry: Reaction-temperature-dependent supramolecular isomerism of coordination networks based on the organometallic building block [CuI2(μ2-BQ)(μ2-OAc)2]
      Masaoka, Shigeyuki; Tanaka, Daisuke; Nakanishi, Yasunori; Kitagawa, Susumu
      Angewandte Chemie, International Edition (2004), 43 (19), 2530-2534CODEN: ACIEF5; ISSN:1433-7851. (Wiley-VCH Verlag GmbH & Co. KGaA)
      Three supramol. isomers, [CuI2(μ4-BQ)(μ2-OAc)2]n (BQ = benzoquinone; α phase), [Cu12(μ3-BQ)(μ2-OAc)(μ3-OAc)]n (β phase), and [Cu12(μ2-BQ)(μ3-OAc)2]n (γ phase), were crystd. by redox reaction of hydroquinone with [Cu2(OAc)4(H2O)2] in ethanol. Bridging of Cu ions can occur via benzoquinone or acetate O atoms. All 3 isomers were characterized by x-ray crystallog.

      10b
      Temperature-dependent supramolecular stereoisomerism in porous copper coordination networks based on a designed carboxylate ligand
      Sun, Daofeng; Ke, Yanxiong; Mattox, Tracy M.; Ooro, Betty A.; Zhou, Hong-Cai
      Chemical Communications (Cambridge, United Kingdom) (2005), (43), 5447-5449CODEN: CHCOFS; ISSN:1359-7345. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
      Two novel temp.-controlled supramol. stereoisomers of porous Cu coordination networks, Cu2(D2-TCPPDA)(H2O)2.2DMSO.6H2O and Cu2(C2h-TCPPDA)(H2O)2.2DMSO.6H2O (H4TCPPDA = N,N,N',N'-tetrakis(4-carboxyphenyl)-1,4-phenylenediamine) were synthesized and characterized. The polymeric complexes have PtS and NbO net topologies, resp. The polymeric complexes have similar thermal stabilities and their Langmuir surface areas and hydrogen storage capacities were detd.

      10c
      Temperature Controlled Reversible Change of the Coordination Modes of the Highly Symmetrical Multitopic Ligand To Construct Coordination Assemblies: Experimental and Theoretical Studies
      Zheng, Bo; Dong, Hao; Bai, Junfeng; Li, Yizhi; Li, Shuhua; Scheer, Manfred
      Journal of the American Chemical Society (2008), 130 (25), 7778-7779CODEN: JACSAT; ISSN:0002-7863. (American Chemical Society)
      By fine-tuning the reaction temp. to 5, 15, 30, and 50°, resp., four different complexes, [Cd(HC4O4)2(H2O)4] (1), [Cd4(C4O4)4(H2O)16]•(H2O)2 (2), [Cd(C4O4)(H2O)2] (3), and [Cd(C4O4)(H2O)2] (4), were formed successfully from the identical initial reaction mixt. contg. Cd(OH)2 and squaric acid. The four complexes were characterized by x-ray crystallog. Also, an unprecedented reversible interconversion among the four complexes at the corresponding reaction temps. mediated by the mother liquor was obsd.

      10d
      Temperature-Controlled Synthesis of Metal-Organic Coordination Polymers: Crystal Structure, Supramolecular Isomerism, and Porous Property
      Kanoo, Prakash; Gurunatha, K. L.; Maji, Tapas Kumar
      Crystal Growth & Design (2009), 9 (9), 4147-4156CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
      Five new supramol. metal-org. coordination polymers (MOCPs), {[Ni(bipy) (H2O)4](2,6-nds)·4H2O} (1), {[Ni(bipy)(H2O)4](2,6-nds)·2H2O} (2), {[Ni (bipy)(H2O)4](2,6-nds)} (3), {[Ni (bipy)(H2O)4](2,6-nds)} (4), {[Cu (bipy)(H2O)4](2,6-nds)} (5) (bipy = 4,4'-bipyridyl; 2,6-nds = 2,6-naphthalenedisulfonate) have been synthesized and structurally characterized. Compds. 1 and 5 were synthesized at room temp. in H2O/EtOH medium, whereas 2-4 were isolated under hydrothermal conditions. Compds. 1-4 were synthesized maintaining the same stoichiometric ratio of metal and ligand under different reaction temps., and the different structures of the compds. indicate that the temp. plays a significant role in the construction of the coordination polymers. Structural characterization reveals that the one-dimensional [M(bipy)(H2O)4]2+ cationic chain is a basic building unit for all of the MOCPs, while 2,6-nds remains as a counteranion. In all cases, 2,6-nds counteranions interact with water and bipy mols. through strong hydrogen-bonding and π-π interactions to afford three-dimensional supramol. structures. Compds. 1-4 have the same building unit with different network superstructures and are related as supramol. isomers. Supramol. isomerism in 3 and 4 is very interesting since they have the same mol. formula, {[Ni(bipy)(H2O)4](2,6-nds)}, and are polymorphs. Compds. 4 and 5 are isomorphous. The thermogravimetric study suggests that the dehydrated compds. are stable up to 300°. Furthermore, sorption studies suggest that dehydrated compds. of 1 and 2 are permanently porous.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD1MXpvV2nsb4%253D&md5=e7efb7696e37adb4c0d793bff194b0f0
    11. 11
      (a) Dincǎ, M.; Dailly, A.; Tsay, C.; Long, J. R. Inorg. Chem. 2008, 47, 11
      [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
      11a
      Expanded Sodalite-Type Metal-Organic Frameworks: Increased Stability and H2 Adsorption through Ligand-Directed Catenation
      Dinca, Mircea; Dailly, Anne; Tsay, Charlene; Long, Jeffrey R.
      Inorganic Chemistry (2008), 47 (1), 11-13CODEN: INOCAJ; ISSN:0020-1669. (American Chemical Society)
      The torsion between the central benzene ring and the outer arom. rings in 1,3,5-tri-p-(tetrazol-5-yl)phenylbenzene (H3TPB-3tz) and the absence of such strain in 2,4,6-tri-p-(tetrazol-5-yl)phenyl-s-triazine (H3TPT-3tz) are shown to allow the selective synthesis of noncatenated and catenated versions of expanded sodalite-type metal-org. frameworks. The reaction of H3TPB-3tz with CuCl2·2H2O affords the noncatenated compd. Cu3[(Cu4Cl)3(TPB-3tz)8]2·11CuCl2·8H2O·120DMF (2), while the reaction of H3TPT-3tz with MnCl2·4H2O or CuCl2·2H2O generates the catenated compds. Mn3[(Mn4Cl)3(TPT-3tz)8]2·25H2O·15CH3OH·95DMF (3) and Cu3[(Cu4Cl)3(TPT-3tz)8]2·xsolvent (4). Significantly, catenation helps to stabilize the framework toward collapse upon desolvation, leading to an increase in the surface area from 1120 to 1580 m2/g and an increase in the hydrogen storage capacity from 2.8 to 3.7 excess wt % at 77 K for 2 and 3, resp. The total hydrogen uptake in desolvated 3 reaches 4.5 wt % and 37 g/L at 80 bar and 77 K, demonstrating that control of catenation can be an important factor in the generation of hydrogen storage materials.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD2sXhsVehurrF&md5=dbdcd76faa0cfbeb9863507ba6a4e1b1
      (b) Dincǎ, M.; Dailly, A.; Liu, Y.; Brown, C. M.; Neumann, D. A.; Long, J. R. J. Am. Chem. Soc. 2006, 128, 12876

The mol. structures of complexes 1 and 2 have been detd. by X-ray crystallog.

      11d
      Three New Heterothiometallic Cluster Polymers with Fascinating Topologies
      Pan, Zhaorui; Xu, Jiao; Zheng, Hegen; Huang, Kexuan; Li, Yizhi; Guo, Zijian; Batten, Stuart R.
      Inorganic Chemistry (2009), 48 (13), 5772-5778CODEN: INOCAJ; ISSN:0020-1669. (American Chemical Society)
      Three new heterothiometallic cluster polymers with fascinating topologies were synthesized by the self-assembly of preformed heterothiometallic cluster monomers and appropriate ligands. Reaction of the monomeric cubic-shaped cluster [Et4N]3[MoOS3Cu3I4] with the D2h symmetry rigid bidentate 4,4'-bipy (4,4'-bipyridine) gave a two-dimensional (2D) layer compd. [Mo2O2S6Cu6I2(4,4'-bipy)3(H2O)]n (1); the assembly of pentanuclear cluster monomer [Et4N]4[WS4Cu4I6] with Cs-sym. bpe (1,2-bis(4-pyridyl)ethane) afforded a 2-dimensional layer compd. [WS4Cu4I2(bpe)3(H2O)]n (2), and the assembly of heptanuclear cluster monomer [Et4N]4[WS4Cu6I8] with D3h symmetry trigonal planar ligand timtz (2,4,6-tri(1H-imidazol-1-yl)-1,3,5-triazine) afforded a three-dimensional (3D) compd. [WS4Cu6I4(timtz)8/3(H2O)12]n (3). X-ray crystallog. anal. reveals that 1 crystallizes in trigonal space group R3‾c with 2-dimensional 36-hxl net which is the 1st heterothiometallic superamol. structure based on a twin cubic-shaped cluster monomer and also the 1st example of 4,4'-bipy-connected compd. of this net. 2 Crystallizes in tetragonal space group P42 with distorted 2-dimensional 36-hxl net which is the 1st flexible-ligand-based compd. of this topol.; while 3 has a 3-dimensional net with the high symmetry of cubic space group I4‾3d, and has a novel α-C3N4 topol., which is the max. symmetry for this net topol. The gas sorption isotherm was measured for 3 to exhibit type-III sorption behavior.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD1MXmvVemt74%253D&md5=49fbdb5665d18b54ad2f62b87545ccb2

      An unprecedented 2D → 3D metal-organic polyrotaxane framework constructed from cadmium and a flexible star-like ligand
      Wu, Hua; Liu, Hai-Yan; Liu, Ying-Ying; Yang, Jin; Liu, Bo; Ma, Jian-Fang
      Chemical Communications (Cambridge, United Kingdom) (2011), 47 (6), 1818-1820CODEN: CHCOFS; ISSN:1359-7345. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
      [Cd(Tipa)Cl2]n·1.07nH2O (1), an unprecedented 2-dimensional → 3-dimensional metal-org. polyrotaxane framework, based on a new star-like tri(4-imidazolylphenyl)amine ligand (Tipa), was synthesized and characterized by single crystal x-ray diffraction anal., luminescence and TGA. 1 Which represents the 1st example of 2-dimensional → 3-dimensional polyrotaxane entangled in a parallel fashion.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BC3MXht1Wgsrk%253D&md5=d4997cc594b58c3c3bab77b5485d55ae

      12b
      Two unprecedented 3D metal-organic polyrotaxane frameworks based on a new flexible tri(imidazole) ligand
      Wu, Hua; Liu, Hai-Yan; Liu, Bo; Yang, Jin; Liu, Ying-Ying; Ma, Jian-Fang; Liu, Yun-Yu; Bai, Hong-Ye
      CrystEngComm (2011), 13 (10), 3402-3407CODEN: CRECF4; ISSN:1466-8033. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
      Two Cd(II)-contg. coordination polymers based on a new tri(4-imidazolylphenyl)amine (Tipa) ligand and carboxylates, namely, [Cd(Tipa)(L1)]·2H2O (1) and [Cd3(Tipa)2(L2)2Cl2]·4H2O (2), where H2L1 = 5-OH-1,3-benzenedicarboxylic acid and H2L2 = 1,4-benzendicarboxylic acid, were synthesized by varying the carboxylates under hydrothermal conditions. In 1, adjacent Cd(II) centers are linked by L1 anions to generate Cd-carboxylate chains, which are further extended by Tipa ligands to form a puckered double sheet. The most peculiar feature of 1 is the entangled fashion between the [Cd2(Tipa)2] loop and the L1 ligand rod. Every [Cd2(Tipa)2] loop of each layer is threaded by one L1 ligand rod of an adjacent layer. In this entangled mode, the 2D → 3D polyrotaxane framework was obtained, which represents an unusual 2D → 3D metal-org. polyrotaxane framework entangled in a highly rare parallel fashion. In 2, two identical 3D self-penetrating frameworks interpenetrate each other in a 2-fold mode. If the authors regard each Cd2(Tipa)2 window as a loop and each L2 ligand as a single rod, undoubtedly, the structure of 2 also can be described as a 3D metal-org. polyrotaxane framework. As far as the authors know, compd. 2 is the first example of a 2-fold interpenetrating 3D framework with polyrotaxane features. The luminescent properties for the two compds. were also studied.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BC3MXmt1yisbw%253D&md5=70562294d53de7beea173f66a2f4956c
      (c) Wu, H.; Liu, H. Y.; Yang, J.; Liu, B.; Ma, J. F.; Liu, Y. Y.; Liu, Y. Y. Cryst. Growth Des. 2011, 11, 2317
      [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
      12c
      Series of Coordination Polymers Based on Different Carboxylates and a Tri(4-imidazolylphenyl)amine Ligand: Entangled Structures and Photoluminescence
      Wu, Hua; Liu, Hai-Yan; Yang, Jin; Liu, Bo; Ma, Jian-Fang; Liu, Ying-Ying; Liu, Yun-Yu
      Crystal Growth & Design (2011), 11 (6), 2317-2324CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
      Seven new coordination polymers, namely, [Cd(Tipa)(L1)2]·H2O (1), [Cd(Tipa)(L2)]·H2O (2), [Cd(Tipa)(L2)]·CH3OH·H2O (3), Cd(Tipa)(L3)(H2O) (4), [Mn(Tipa)(L2)]·H2O (5), [Ni2(Tipa)2(L4)(H2O)2]2·Cl4·4H2O (6), and [Ni2(Tipa)2(L5)(H2O)4]·(H4L5)·0.5H2O (7), where HL1 = benzoic acid, H2L2 = 5-amino-1,3-benzenedicarboxylic acid, H2L3 = 2-(4-carboxybenzylamino)benzoic acid, H2L4 = 1,4-benzenedicarboxylic acid, H4L5 = 1,2,4,5-benzenetetracarboxylic acid, and Tipa = tris(4-(1-imidazolyl)phenyl)amine, have been synthesized by varying the carboxylate anions and metal centers under hydrothermal conditions. Compd. 1 shows a one-dimensional (1D) chain. Compds. 2 and 5 are isostructural and display (3,5)-connected (42·6)(42·67·8) topol. In the two compds., the identical 2D networks entangle in highly rare parallel fashions to give fascinating 2D → 3D frameworks with polycatenation and polyrotaxane characters. Compd. 3 displays a 2-fold interpenetrating 3D framework with (3,5)-connected (63)(65·85) topol. The structure of 4 is a 4-fold interpenetrating 3D (10,3)-b framework. 6 Is an uncommon 4-fold interpenetrating 3D framework with (3,4)-connected (4·82)(4·85) topol. 7 Exhibits an unprecedented 2D → 2D polyrotaxane layer with (3,4)-connected (42·6)(42·63·8) topol. The IR spectra, elemental analyses, and luminescent properties for the compds. were also studied.

      A new type of entangled motif: from 2D polyrotaxane layers to a 3D polythreaded framework
      Wu, Hua; Liu, Bo; Yang, Jin; Liu, Hai-Yan; Ma, Jian-Fang
      CrystEngComm (2011), 13 (11), 3661-3664CODEN: CRECF4; ISSN:1466-8033. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
      Compd. [Ni2(Tipa)2(L)2(H2O)2]·3.25H2O (Tipa = tri(4-imidazolylphenyl)amine and L = 1,4-benzenedicarboxylate) was prepd. by hydrothermal reaction. A new type of 3D entangled motif constructed from 2D polyrotaxane layers was synthesized and characterized, which represents the first example of a 2D → 3D polythreaded framework with both polyrotaxane and polypseudo-rotaxane character.

      12e
      An Exceptional 54-Fold Interpenetrated Coordination Polymer with 103-srs Network Topology
      Wu, Hua; Yang, Jin; Su, Zhong-Min; Batten, Stuart R.; Ma, Jian-Fang
      Journal of the American Chemical Society (2011), 133 (30), 11406-11409CODEN: JACSAT; ISSN:0002-7863. (American Chemical Society)
      Entanglement is one of the most important features of coordination polymer frameworks and has attracted considerable attention due to its aesthetic and topol. interest. Among entangled systems, interpenetrating frameworks represent an intriguing subset; however, there are few examples of materials contg. very high levels of interpenetration. A coordination polymer with 103-srs topol., constructed from a star-like tridentate ligand, tri(4-imidazolylphenyl)amine, and AgI ions, [Ag3(OH)(H2O)2(Tipa)2.5][Mo2O7]·4.5H2O (Tipa = tris(4-imidazolylphenyl)amine), was hydrothermally synthesized. It contains a record 54 interpenetrating networks.
      >> More from SciFinder ®

      (f) Wu, H.; Ma, J. F.; Liu, Y. Y.; Yang, J.; Liu, H. Y. CrystEngComm 2011, 13, 7121

      12f
      Diverse topologies of six coordination polymers constructed from a tris(4-imidazolylphenyl)amine ligand and different carboxylates
      Wu, Hua; Ma, Jian-Fang; Liu, Ying-Ying; Yang, Jin; Liu, Hai-Yan
      CrystEngComm (2011), 13 (23), 7121-7128CODEN: CRECF4; ISSN:1466-8033. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
      Six new coordination polymers, namely, [Zn(Tipa)(L1)]·H2O (1), [Zn2(Tipa)(L2)(μ2-OH)]·2H2O (2), [Zn2(Tipa)(L3)]·3.5H2O (3), [Mn(Tipa)(L1)]·H2O (4), [Cu4(Tipa)4(L4)2(CH3OH)2(H2O)2]·2(L4)·3(CH3OH)·8(H2O) (5), and Co3(Tipa)2(L4)3 (6), where H2L1 = 1,3-benzenedicarboxylic acid, H3L2 = 1,3,5-benzenetricarboxylic acid, H4L3 = 1,2,4,5-benzenetetracarboxylic acid, H2L4 = 1,4-benzenedicarboxylic acid and Tipa = tris(4-imidazolylphenyl)amine, were synthesized by varying the carboxylates and metals under hydrothermal conditions. Compd. 1 shows a 2D 3D framework with parallel polycatenation of undulated square layers (sql). Compd. 2 displays a 3D 3,4-connected (5.62·82·9)(63·72·9)(73)(62·8) topol., while compd. 3 reveals a 3D 3,4,6-connected (42·62·7.8)(4.6.83·10)(6.8·10)(44·52·67·7.8)(42·82·102) topol. Compd. 4 shows a 2D undulate layer. Compd. 5 exhibits an unprecedented 2D 2D polyrotaxane network with (3,4)-connected (4.52)(4.53·72) topol. The neighboring 2D polyrotaxane sheets are sandwiched by the free L4 ligands. Compd. 6 is an unusual example of a 3D 2-fold interpenetrating framework with polyrotaxane feature. The effects of the carboxylates and metals were elucidated. The IR spectra, elemental analyses and luminescent properties for the compds. also were studied.
      >> More from SciFinder ®

      (g) Yao, X. Q.; Cao, D. P.; Hu, J. S.; Li, Y. Z.; Guo, Z. J.; Zheng, H. G. Cryst. Growth Des. 2011, 11, 231

      12g
      Chiral and Porous Coordination Polymers Based on an N-Centered Triangular Rigid Ligand
      Yao, Xiao-Qiang; Cao, Da-Peng; Hu, Jin-Song; Li, Yi-Zhi; Guo, Zi-Jian; Zheng, He-Gen
      Crystal Growth & Design (2011), 11 (1), 231-239CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
      Four cadmium and cobalt coordination polymers with unique structures and topologies, [Cd(TIPA)(NO3)2·5H2O]n (1), [Co(TIPA)1/3Cl·2H2O]n (2), [Co(TIPA)(5-OH-bdc)·2H2O]n (3) and [Cd2(TIPA)2(5-OH-bdc)2·5.5H2O]n (4), were successfully synthesized under solvothermal conditions by employing an elongated triangular rigid N-contg. ligand tris(4-(1H-imidazol-1-yl)phenyl)amine (TIPA) and 5-hydroxyisophthalic acid (5-OH-H2bdc) as anion coligand. Compds. 1-4 were characterized by single crystal x-ray structure analyses, thermogravimetric analyses, SHG, and photoluminescent measurements. Compd. 1 crystallizes in the chiral space group C2 and features a 2-dimensional → 3-dimensional parallel/parallel inclined polycatenated framework. Compd. 2 crystallizes in trigonal symmetry with a high-symmetry space group R‾3 and features a 2-dimensional porous noninterpenetrating coordination network. Compd. 3 crystallizes in the monoclinic space group P21/n and shows a 2-dimensional → 3-dimensional parallel/parallel polycatenation framework, and compd. 4 crystallizes in the orthorhombic chiral space group P212121 and shows a very rarely 3-dimensional + 3-dimensional heterogeneous 2-fold interpenetration framework built from (3,5)-connected (42·65·83)(42·6) AFUQOH nets and (3,5)-connected (63)(69·8) gra nets.
      >> More from SciFinder ®

      12h
      Two Porous Zinc Coordination Polymers with (10,3) Topological Features Based on a N-Centered Tripodal Ligand and the Conversion of a (10,3)-d Subnet to a (10,3)-a Subnet
      Yao, Xiao-Qiang; Zhang, Ming-Dao; Hu, Jin-Song; Li, Yi-Zhi; Guo, Zi-Jian; Zheng, He-Gen
      Crystal Growth & Design (2011), 11 (7), 3039-3044CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
      Two porous (3,4)-connected zinc coordination polymers, {[Zn(TIPA)(mal)1/2]·(NO3)·3H2O}n (1) and {[Zn(TIPA)(glu)1/2]·(NO3)·H2O}n (2) (mal = malonic acid, glu = glutaric acid, TIPA = tris(4-(1H-imidazol-1-yl)phenyl)amine) were solvothermally synthesized and characterized. Complex 1 crystallizes in the orthorhombic space group Pnna contg. an unusual 3D subnet with (10,3)-d topol. and left- and right-handed helical channels. Complex 2 crystallizes in the orthorhombic chiral space group P2221 contg. an unusual 3D chiral subnet with (10,3)-a topol. and 4-fold right-handed helical channels. The conversion of achiral complex 1 with a (10,3)-d (utp) achiral subnet to chiral complex 2 with a (10,3)-a (srs) chiral subnet was successfully induced by increasing the length of ditopic aliph. dicarboxylic acid. Second harmonic generation (SHG) measurement was performed on complex 2 revealing that 2 has a strong SHG response, and the SHG efficiency is ∼0.8 times that of urea (∼8 times that of KDP). In addn., photoluminescence and TGA were also performed on 1 and 2.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BC3MXnsFWisLw%253D&md5=768609428a3e7ffd6808642cbe779ded

      The rational synthesis of (10,3)-type MOFs based on tetranuclear [W(Mo)OS3Cu3]+ secondary building units
      Yao, Xiao-Qiang; Pan, Zhao-Rui; Hu, Jin-Song; Li, Yi-Zhi; Guo, Zi-Jian; Zheng, He-Gen
      Chemical Communications (Cambridge, United Kingdom) (2011), 47 (36), 10049-10051CODEN: CHCOFS; ISSN:1359-7345. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
      The self-assembly of preformed clusters with two extended linear and trigonal rigid ligands as org. linkers afforded two 2-dimensional {[MoOS3Cu3(bibp)2.5](I)}n (1) (bibp = 4,4'-di(1H-imidazol-1-yl)-1,1'-biphenyl) and 3-dimensional {[WOS3Cu3Br(TIPA)](H2O)(DMF)}n (TIPA = tris(4-(1H-imidazol-1-yl)phenyl)amine) cluster polymers. They show unprecedented structure types in Mo(W)/S/Cu chem. and exhibit strong 3rd-order nonlinear optical properties.

      13a
      Structural variation from 1D to 3D: effects of ligands and solvents on the construction of lead(II)-organic coordination polymers
      Yang, Jin; Li, Guo-Dong; Cao, Jun-Jun; Yue, Qi; Li, Guang-Hua; Chen, Jie-Sheng
      Chemistry--A European Journal (2007), 13 (11), 3248-3261CODEN: CEUJED; ISSN:0947-6539. (Wiley-VCH Verlag GmbH & Co. KGaA)
      PbII coordination polymers [Pb(ndc)(dpp)] (1), [Pb(ndc)(ptcp)]·0.5H2O (2), [Pb(ndc)(dppz)] (3), [Pb(ndc)(tcpn)2] (4), [Pb2(ndc)2(tcpp)] (5), [Pb(Hndc)2]·H2O (6), [Pb(ndc)(dma)] (7), [Pb(bdc)(dma)] (8), [Pb(trans-chdc)(H2O)] (9), and [Pb2(cis-chdc)2]·NHMe2 (10), where ndc = 1,4-naphthalenedicarboxylate, dpp = 4,7-diphenyl-1,10-phenanthroline, ptcp = 2-phenyl-1H-1,3,7,8-tetraazacyclopenta[l]phenanthrene, dppz = dipyrido[3,2-a:2',3'-c]phenazine, tcpn = 2-(1H-1,3,7,8-tetraazacyclopenta[l]phenanthren-2-yl)naphthol, tcpp = 4-(1H-1,3,7,8-tetraazacyclopenta[l]phenanthren-2-yl)phenol, dma = N,N-dimethylacetamide, bdc = 1,4-benzenedicarboxylate, and chdc = 1,4-cyclohexanedicarboxylate, were synthesized from a hydrothermal or solvothermal reaction system by varying the ligands or the solvents. Compds. 1-5 crystallize with an N-donor chelating ligand and an arom. dicarboxylate linker. Compds. 1-4 are 1-dimensional polymers with different π-π stacking interactions, whereas compd. 5 consists of 2-dimensional layers. The structures of compds. 7, 8, and 10 are 3-dimensional frameworks formed by connection of the Pb centers by org. acid ligands. Compd. 7 is chiral although the ndc ligand is achiral, while the framework of 8 is a typical 3-dimensional (3,4)-connected net. Compd. 10 is the 1st example of PbII wheel cluster [Pb8O8] units bridged by carboxylate groups. Compd. 6 contains ID chains which are further extended to a 3-dimensional structure by π-π interactions. Compd. 9 consists of a 2-dimensional network constructed by PbII centers and trans-chdc ligands. The structural differences between 7 and 8 and between 9 and 10 indicate the importance of solvents for framework formation of the coordination polymers. By varying the solvent the cis and trans conformations of H2chdc in 9 and 10 were sepd. completely. The photoluminescence and nonlinear optical properties of the coordination polymers also were studied.
      >> More from SciFinder ®

      14c
      Alteration of Molecular Conformations, Coordination Modes, and Architectures for a Novel 3,8-Diimidazolyl-1,10-phenanthroline Compound in the Construction of Cadmium(II) and Zinc(II) Homochiral Coordination Polymers Involving an Auxiliary Chiral Camphorate Ligand
      Wang, Li; You, Wei; Huang, Wei; Wang, Cheng; You, Xiao-Zeng
      Inorganic Chemistry (Washington, DC, United States) (2009), 48 (10), 4295-4305CODEN: INOCAJ; ISSN:0020-1669. (American Chemical Society)
      A novel 3,8-diimidazolyl-1,10-phenanthroline (1) compd. was prepd. from the C-N bond cross-coupling reaction. X-ray structural studies for 1 and 1·2H2O (2) reveal they have different mol. conformations (Lb in 1 and Lc·2H2O in 2). Two Cd(II) and one Zn(II) complexes of 3,8-diimidazolyl-1,10-phenanthroline, formulated as [Cd2(D-cam)2(La)2]·(H2O)6 (3), [Cd2(D-cam)2(La)(H2O)] (4), and [Zn2(D-cam)2(Lb)2]·(H2O)5 (5), were obtained involving an auxiliary chiral ligand D-cam (a dianion of D-camphoric acid) where the 3,8-diimidazolyl-1,10-phenanthroline ligand shows different mol. conformations, coordination modes, and architectures. Also, D-cam and 3,8-diimidazolyl-1,10-phenanthroline ligands exhibit different bridging fashions to construct a homochiral 2-dimensional coordination polymer 3 and two homochiral 3-dimensional coordination polymers 4 and 5. D. function theory computational studies on comparing the different mol. conformations of the 3,8-diimidazolyl-1,10-phenanthroline ligand as well as spectral, nonlinear optical, and thermal properties for related compds. before and after the metal-ion complexation also were carried out.

      14d
      Two Thermostable Three-Dimensional Homochiral Metal-Organic Polymers with Quartz Topology
      Liang, Li-Li; Ren, Shi-Bin; Zhang, Jun; Li, Yi-Zhi; Du, Hong-Bin; You, Xiao-Zeng
      Crystal Growth & Design (2010), 10 (3), 1307-1311CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
      Two new homochiral metal-org. coordination polymers, M2(TPOM)(D-Cam)2(H2O)2 (M = Zn for 1, Cd for 2, D-H2cam = D-camphoric acid, TPOM = tetrakis(4-pyridyloxymethyl)methane), were prepd. under solvothermal conditions and characterized by single crystal x-ray structure analyses, thermogravimetric analyses, CD, 2nd-order nonlinear optical (NLO), and photoluminescent measurements. Compds. 1 and 2 are isostructural and crystallize in the chiral space group P21212. In 1, Zn(II) is tetrahedrally coordinated, while Cd(II) in 2 is six-coordinate. Both possess a three-dimensional (3D) framework with a 4-connected node. Tetrahedral quadridentate linker TPOM connects four M(II) ions through its four peripheral pyridyl groups to form a wavelike two-dimensional (2D) sheet [M2(TPOM)]n. The chiral bidentate D-H2cam ligand connects two M(II) ions to form a homochiral left-handed 1-dimensional helical chains of [M(D-cam)]n. The homochiral helical chains interweave the 2-dimensional wavelike sheets via sharing the metal sites to form a 3-dimensional homochiral framework with 2-fold interpenetrating quartz (6482) topol. Both 1 and 2 are NLO-active materials and exhibit relatively high thermal stabilities.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD1MXhsVGisrjO&md5=3c83f6ee21406b73b13c36c6a878f2e5

      Self-Assembly of Metal-Organic Coordination Polymers Constructed from a Versatile Multipyridyl Ligand: Diversity of Coordination Modes and Structures
      Liang, Xiao-Qiang; Zhou, Xin-Hui; Chen, Chao; Xiao, Hong-Ping; Li, Yi-Zhi; Zuo, Jing-Lin; You, Xiao-Zeng
      Crystal Growth & Design (2009), 9 (2), 1041-1053CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
      Six d10 metal metal-org. coordination polymers, {[Zn2(Htpim)2(tp)2]·2H2O}n (1), {[Cd3(H0.5tpim)4(pa)2(H2O)2]·5H2O}n (2), [Zn(Htpim)(Htma)]n (3), {[Zn4(Htpim)4(ipt)4]·2H2O}n (4), [Cd(Htpim)(ca)]n (5), and {[Cd4(Htpim)2(D-ca)4(H2O)2]·5H2O}n (6) (Htpim = 2,4,5-tri(4-pyridyl)imidazole, H2tp = terephthalic acid, H2pa = phthalic acid, H3tma = trimesic acid, H2ipt = isophthalic acid, H2ca = racemic camphor acid, D-H2ca = D-camphor acid), were prepd. and structurally characterized. In all complexes, the rigid ligand Htpim exhibits different coordination modes and gives various architectures. Complex 1 shows a two-dimensional (2D) network with (6,3) topol., where hydrogen-bonding interactions further link these sheets to a three-dimensional (3D) supramol. structure. Complex 2 exhibits a 2-dimensional layer with (53)(54) network topol. Complex 3 is a corrugated 2-dimensional layer with (4,4) topol., and the sepd. layers are connected through weak π-π stacking interactions to generate a 3-dimensional supramol. architecture. Complex 4 is a rhombic 2-dimensional layer with (4,4) topol., and the 3-dimensional overlapped array is formed by hydrogen-bonding and π-π stacking interactions. A 3-dimensional diamondoid framework with 4-fold interpenetration is found in 5. Complex 6 contains a complicated 3-dimensional framework, and the vacancy is occupied by the guest water mols. Their luminescent properties were studied in the solid state.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD1MXpsF2m&md5=b898ea75f9180806c6a49d07923e86f6
      (c) Chen, B. L.; Zhao, X.; Putkham, A.; Hong, K.; Lobkovsky, E. B.; Hurtado, E. J.; Fletcher, A. J.; Thomas, K. M. J. Am. Chem. Soc. 2008, 130, 6411
      [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
      15c
      Surface Interactions and Quantum Kinetic Molecular Sieving for H2 and D2 Adsorption on a Mixed Metal-Organic Framework Material
      Chen, Banglin; Zhao, Xuebo; Putkham, Apipong; Hong, Kunlun; Lobkovsky, Emil B.; Hurtado, Eric J.; Fletcher, Ashleigh J.; Thomas, K. Mark
      Journal of the American Chemical Society (2008), 130 (20), 6411-6423CODEN: JACSAT; ISSN:0002-7863. (American Chemical Society)
      A rational strategy was used to immobilize open metal sites in ultramicroporosity for stronger binding of multiple H2 mols. per unsatd. metal site for H2 storage applications. The synthesis and structure of a mixed Zn/Cu metal-org. framework material Zn3(BDC)3[Cu(Pyen)]·(DMF)5(H2O)5 (H2BDC = 1,4-benzenedicarboxylic acid and PyenH2 = (5-methyl-4-hydroxopyridine-3-methylene)ethylenediaminecarbaldehyde) is reported. Desolvation provides a bimodal porous structure Zn3(BDC)3[Cu(Pyen)] (M'MOF 1) with narrow porosity (<0.56 nm) and an array of pores in the bc crystallog. plane where the adsorbate-adsorbent interactions are maximized by both the presence of open Cu centers and overlap of the potential energy fields from pore walls. The H2 and D2 adsorption isotherms for M'MOF 1 at 77.3 and 87.3 K were reversible with virtually no hysteresis. Methods for detn. of the isosteric enthalpies of H2 and D2 adsorption were compared. A virial model gave the best agreement (av. deviation <1 std. deviation) with the isotherm data. This was used in conjunction with the van't Hoff isochore giving isosteric enthalpies at zero surface coverage of 12.29 ± 0.53 and 12.44 ± 0.50 kJ mol-1 for H2 and D2 adsorption, resp. This is the highest value so far obsd. for H adsorption on a porous material. The enthalpy of adsorption, decreases with increasing amt. adsorbed to 9.5 kJ mol-1 at .ltorsim.≈1.9 mmol g-1 (2 H2 or D2 mols. per Cu corresponding to adsorption on both sides of planar Cu open centers) and is virtually unchanged in the range 1.9-3.6 mmol g-1. Virial anal. of isotherms at 87.3 K is also consistent with 2 H2 or D2 mols. being bound to each open Cu center. The adsorption kinetics follow a double exponential model, corresponding to diffusion along 2 types of pores, a slow component with high activation energy (13.35 ± 0.59 kJ mol-1) for the narrow pores and a faster component with low activation energy (8.56 ± 0.41 kJ mol-1). The D2 adsorption kinetic consts. for both components were significantly faster than the corresponding H2 kinetics for specific pressure increments and had slightly lower activation energies than the corresponding values for H2 adsorption. The kD2/kH2 ratio for the slow component was 1.62 ± 0.07, while the fast component was 1.38 ± 0.04 at 77.3 K, and the corresponding ratios were smaller at 87.3 K. These observations of kinetic isotope quantum mol. sieving in porous materials are due to the larger zero-point energy for the lighter H2, resulting in slower adsorption kinetics compared with the heavier D2. A combination of open metal centers and confinement in ultramicroporosity leads to a high enthalpy for H2 adsorption over a wide range of surface coverage and quantum effects influence diffusion of H2 and D2 in pores in M'MOF 1.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD1cXltVyjsLo%253D&md5=cd9993fbfa093dfecfd6324ec8f7d042
      (d) Reineke, T. M.; Eddaoudi, M.; O’Keeffe, M.; Yaghi, O. M. Angew. Chem., Int. Ed. 1999, 38, 2590
      [Crossref], [PubMed], [CAS], Google Scholar
      15d
      A microporous lanthanide - organic framework
      Reineke, Theresa M.; Eddaoudi, Mohamed; O'Keeffe, M.; Yaghi, Omar M.
      Angewandte Chemie, International Edition (1999), 38 (17), 2590-2594CODEN: ACIEF5; ISSN:1433-7851. (Wiley-VCH Verlag GmbH)
      The synthesis and crystal structure of Tb(bdc)NO3·2DMF (bdc = 1,4-benzenedicarboxylate) is reported, and its desolvated form is shown to have a stable zeolite-like framework. Each terbium is bonded to eight oxygen atoms, 4 from 4 different bdc ligands, 2 from a bidentate nitrate and 2 from 2 DMF ligands. Tb(bdc)NO3 is capable of reversible mol. sorption and maintains its microporosity in the absence of included guests.

      (a) Allendorf, M. D.; Bauer, C. A.; Bhakta, R. K.; Houk, R. J. T. Chem. Soc. Rev. 2009, 38, 1330
      [Crossref], [PubMed], [CAS], Google Scholar
      20a
      Luminescent metal-organic frameworks
      Allendorf, M. D.; Bauer, C. A.; Bhakta, R. K.; Houk, R. J. T.
      Chemical Society Reviews (2009), 38 (5), 1330-1352CODEN: CSRVBR; ISSN:0306-0012. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
      A review; metal-org. frameworks (MOFs) display a wide range of luminescent behaviors resulting from the multifaceted nature of their structure. In this crit. review we discuss the origins of MOF luminosity, which include the linker, the coordinated metal ions, antenna effects, excimer and exciplex formation, and guest mols. The literature describing these effects is comprehensively surveyed, including a categorization of each report according to the type of luminescence obsd. Finally, we discuss potential applications of luminescent MOFs. This review will be of interest to researchers and synthetic chemists attempting to design luminescent MOFs, and those engaged in the extension of MOFs to applications such as chem., biol., and radiation detection, medical imaging, and electro-optical devices.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD1MXkvVamurg%253D&md5=9219edb8997dd29d5f61edbe8e99797d
      (b) Zheng, S. L.; Yang, J. H.; Yu, X. L.; Chen, X. M.; Wong, W. T. Inorg. Chem. 2004, 43, 830
      [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
      20b
      Syntheses, Structures, Photoluminescence, and Theoretical Studies of d10 Metal Complexes of 2,2'-Dihydroxy-[1,1']binaphthalenyl-3,3'-dicarboxylate
      Zheng, Shao-Liang; Yang, Jin-Hua; Yu, Xiao-Lan; Chen, Xiao-Ming; Wong, Wing-Tak
      Inorganic Chemistry (2004), 43 (2), 830-838CODEN: INOCAJ; ISSN:0020-1669. (American Chemical Society)
      The free solvated ligand, H2bna·MeOH·H2O (1), and its dimeric complex, [Cd2(bna)2(H2O)6] (2) (bna = 2,2'-dihydroxy-[1,1']-binaphthalene-3,3'-dicarboxylate), were obtained by evapn. of the solns., while two new d10 metal-hydroxy cluster-based coordination polymers, [Cd8(OH)4(H2O)10(bna)6]·17H2O (3) and [Hpy]2[Zn4(OH)2(H2O)2(bna)4]·2H2O·2MeCN (4), were obtained by a hydrothermal route. All the compds. were characterized by x-ray crystallog. and photoluminescence measurements. Compd. 1 consists of a three-dimensional, H-bonded supramol. array, 2 exhibits a dimeric mol. featuring a square motif organized by two Cd(II) atoms and two bna ligands each at the corner, and 3 contains unprecedented [Cd8(μ3-OH)2(μ-OH)2(μ-H2O)2]12+ octanuclear metallacrown cores which are interlinked through bna to afford a two-dimensional structure, while 4 features layers with butterfly-shaped [Zn4(μ3-OH)2]6+ clusters. All the complexes display photoluminescent properties in the blue/green range. The manifestation of photoluminescence, as probed by MO calcns. performed on the complexes and also on hypothetical multinuclear complexes, is attributed to a ligand-to-metal charge-transfer mechanism. In addn. to presenting a new approach for the study of the photoluminescent properties of metal-cluster-based coordination polymers by using simple model compds., the study also reveals the dominant role of the structure of the ligand over that of the d10 metal-hydroxy (or oxy) cluster and the presence of the cluster significantly increasing the emission lifetime.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD2cXnt1w%253D&md5=e62d73a4481385bcf409a5682ce12b75
    21. 21
      (a) Li, X.; Sun, H. L.; Wu, X. S.; Qiu, X.; Du, M. Inorg. Chem. 2010, 49, 1865
      [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
      21a
      Unique (3,12)-Connected Porous Lanthanide-Organic Frameworks Based on Ln4O4 Clusters: Synthesis, Crystal Structures, Luminescence, and Magnetism
      Li, Xia; Sun, Hao-Ling; Wu, Xiao-Shuo; Qiu, Xiao; Du, Miao
      Inorganic Chemistry (Washington, DC, United States) (2010), 49 (4), 1865-1871CODEN: INOCAJ; ISSN:0020-1669. (American Chemical Society)
      Three porous lanthanide-org. frameworks, [Ln4(OH)4(3-SBA)4(H2O)4]·nH2O [Ln = EuIII (1), n = 10; GdIII (2), n = 10; TbIII (3), n = 8; 3-SBA = 3-sulfobenzoate], were prepd. by a hydrothermal synthesis method. They are isomorphous and crystallize in a tetragonal system with space group P421c. The structure can be considered to be built up by cubane-like [Ln4(OH)4]8+ secondary building units, which are further connected by 3-SBA to form a 3-dimensional coordination framework with 1-dimensional pores along the c direction for accommodation of novel T8(3) water tapes or zigzag water chains. Also, in these compds., the [Ln4(OH)4]8+ units and 3-SBA ligands serve as 12-connected and 3-connected nodes, resp., resulting in a unique (3,12)-connected framework with the Schlafli symbol of (43)4(420.628.818). The luminescent properties of the EuIII (1) and TbIII (3) complexes were studied, showing characteristic emissions at room temp. Variable-temp. magnetic susceptibility studies indicate that the GdIII complex 2 displays weak antiferromagnetic coupling through μ3-OH- pathways.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BC3cXnt1Sqtw%253D%253D&md5=2005693e8c30c88c5d2cd2735e9e9c07
      (b) Hu, J. S.; Shang, Y. J.; Yao, X. Q.; Qin, L.; Li, Y. Z.; Guo, Z. J.; Zheng, H. G.; Xue, Z. L. Cryst. Growth Des. 2010, 10, 2676
      [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
      21b
      Syntheses, Structures, and Photoluminescence of Five New Metal-Organic Frameworks Based on Flexible Tetrapyridines and Aromatic Polycarboxylate Acids
      Hu, Jin-Song; Shang, Yong-Jia; Yao, Xiao-qiang; Qin, Ling; Li, Yi-Zhi; Guo, Zi-Jian; Zheng, He-Gen; Xue, Zi-Ling
      Crystal Growth & Design (2010), 10 (6), 2676-2684CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
      Solvothermal reactions of tetrakis(4-pyridyloxymethylene)methane (TPOM) with deprotonated 1,4-benzenedicarboxylate (H2bdc) or 5-hydroxyisophthalic acid (5-OH-H2bdc) in the presence of nitrates of cadmium, zinc, and cobalt in H2O or H2O/DMF produced five new complexes, namely, {[Cd2(TPOM)(bdc)2]·(H2O)5(DMF)}n (1), {[Zn2(TPOM)(bdc)2]·(H2O)4}n (2), {[Zn2(TPOM)(bdc)2]·(H2O)}n (3), {[Co2(TPOM)(5-OH-bdc)2(H2O)2]·(H2O)5}n (4), and {[Cd2(TPOM)(5-OH-bdc)2]·(H2O)2}n (5). These complexes were characterized by elemental anal., IR spectroscopy, and x-ray single-crystal diffraction. Complex 1 reveals a 2-fold interpenetrating three-dimensional (3D) framework with pcu topol. constructed from binuclear Cd clusters and TPOM ligands. In addn., the expt. of single-crystal-to-single-crystal (SC-SC) structural transformations upon guest exchange was tested. Zn complexes 2 and 3 possess different 3D frameworks and are prepd. from TPOM and H2bdc under different reaction conditions. In complexes 4 and 5, TPOM and 5-OH-H2bdc link Co or Cd centers to generate 3D interpenetrating frameworks with bbf and qtz topol. In addn., thermal stabilities and photochem. properties of these new complexes in the solid state have been studied.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BC3cXltlygtrk%253D&md5=c74da9c559e8b27a2df20dd1b9af2039
    22. 22
      (a) Seneviratne, D. S.; Uddin, M. J.; Swayambunathan, V.; Schlegel, H. B.; Endicott, J. F. Inorg. Chem. 2002, 41, 1502
      [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
      22a
      Characteristics and Properties of Metal-to-Ligand Charge-Transfer Excited States in 2,3-Bis(2-pyridyl)pyrazine and 2,2'-Bipyridine Ruthenium Complexes. Perturbation-Theory-Based Correlations of Optical Absorption and Emission Parameters with Electrochemistry and Thermal Kinetics and Related Ab Initio Calculations
      Seneviratne, Dhehinie S.; Uddin, Md. Jamal; Swayambunathan, V.; Schlegel, H. Bernhard; Endicott, John F.
      Inorganic Chemistry (2002), 41 (6), 1502-1517CODEN: INOCAJ; ISSN:0020-1669. (American Chemical Society)
      The absorption, emission, and IR spectra, metal (Ru) and ligand (PP) half-wave potentials, and ab initio calcns. on the ligands (PP) are compared for several [LnRu(PP)]2+ and [{LnRu}dpp{RuL'n}]4+ complexes, where Ln and L'n = (bpy)2 or (NH3)4 and PP = 2,2'-bipyridine (bpy), 2,3-bis(2-pyridyl)pyrazine (dpp), 2,3-bis(2-pyridyl)quinoxaline (dpq), or 2,3-bis(2-pyridyl)benzoquinoxaline (dpb). The energy of the metal-to-ligand charge-transfer (MLCT) absorption max. (hνmax) varies in nearly direct proportion to the difference between RuIII/RuII and (PP)/(PP)- half-wave potentials, ΔE1/2, for the monometallic complexes but not for the bimetallic complexes. The MLCT spectra of [(NH3)4Ru(dpp)]2+ exhibit three prominent visible-near-UV absorptions, compared to two for [(NH3)4Ru(bpy)]2+, and are not easily reconciled with the MLCT spectra of [{(NH3)4Ru}dpp{RuLn}]4+. The ab initio calcns. indicate that the two lowest energy π* orbitals are not much different in energy in the PP ligands (they correlate with the degenerate π* orbitals of benzene) and that both contribute to the obsd. MLCT transitions. The LUMO energies calcd. for the monometallic complexes correlate strongly with the obsd. hνmax (cor. for variations in metal contribution). The LUMO computed for dpp correlates with LUMO + 1 of pyrazine. This inversion of the order of the two lowest energy π* orbitals is unique to dpp in this series of ligands. Configurational mixing of the ground and MLCT excited states is treated as a small perturbation of the overall energies of the metal complexes, resulting in a contribution εs to the ground-state energy. The fraction of charge delocalized, αDA2, is expected to attenuate the reorganizational energy, χreorg, by a factor of approx. (1-4αDA2 + αDA4), relative to the limit where there is no charge delocalization. This appears to be a substantial effect for these complexes (αDA2equiv. 0.1 for RuII/bpy), and it leads to smaller reorganizational energies for emission than for absorption. Reorganizational energies are inferred from the bandwidths found in Gaussian analyses of the emission and/or absorption spectra. Exchange energies are estd. from the Stokes shifts combined with perturbation-theory-based relation between the reorganizational energies for absorption and emission values. The results indicate that εs is dominated by terms that contribute to electron delocalization between metal and PP ligand. This inference is supported by the large shifts in the N-H stretching frequency of coordinated NH3 as the no. of PP ligands is increased. The measured properties of the bpy and dpp ligands seem to be very similar, but electron delocalization appears to be slightly larger (10-40%) and the exchange energy contributions appear to be comparable (e.g., ∼1.7 × 103 cm-1 in [Ru(bpy)2dpp]2+ compared to ∼1.3 × 103 cm-1 in the bpy analog).
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD38XhsV2hsbw%253D&md5=c6e2de2b41b6601e799f2f6fa45cc2d2
      (b) Castellano, F. N.; Henryk, M.; Gryczynski, I.; Lakowicz, J. R. Inorg. Chem. 1997, 36, 5548
      [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
      22b
      Creation of Metal-to-Ligand Charge Transfer Excited States with Two-Photon Excitation
      Castellano, Felix N.; Malak, Henryk; Gryczynski, Ignacy; Lakowicz, Joseph R.
      Inorganic Chemistry (1997), 36 (24), 5548-5551CODEN: INOCAJ; ISSN:0020-1669. (American Chemical Society)
      We examd. the steady state and time-resolved emission spectral properties of [Ru(bpy)3]2+ and [Ru(bpy)2(dcb)]2+, where bpy is 2,2'-bipyridine and dcb is 2,2'-bipyridine-4,4'-dicarboxylic acid, in fluid soln. when excited with 90 fs pulses from a mode-locked Ti/sapphire laser. Over the wavelength range 820-900 nm, both complexes displayed two-photon excitation as obsd. by a quadratic dependence of the emission intensity on incident power. Steady state emission and time-resolved frequency-domain intensity decay measurements revealed that two-photon excitation of each complex resulted in the same emission spectra and single-exponential decays as obsd. for one-photon excitation at a variety of temps. in different solvents. The two-photon excitation cross section of [Ru(bpy)3]2+ measured at 880 nm was detd. to be 4.3 × 10-50 cm4 s/photon. These results clearly show that metal-to-ligand charge transfer (MLCT) excited states can in fact be obtained through multiphoton processes.
      >> More from SciFinder ®

      1. 1
        (a) Pang, J.; Marcotte, E. J. P.; Seward, C.; Brown, R. S.; Wang, S. Angew. Chem., Int. Ed. 2001, 40, 4042
        [Crossref], [PubMed], [CAS], Google Scholar
        1a
        A blue luminescent star-shaped ZnII complex that can detect benzene
        Pang, Jun; Marcotte, Eric J.-P.; Seward, Corey; Brown, R. Stephen; Wang, Suning
        Angewandte Chemie, International Edition (2001), 40 (21), 4042-4045CODEN: ACIEF5; ISSN:1433-7851. (Wiley-VCH Verlag GmbH)
        The authors synthesized a new class of blue luminescent org. star-shaped mols.-that contain either 7-azaindolyl or 2,2'-dipyridylamino groups. Some of the new star-shaped mols. have been found to be promising blue emitters in electroluminescence devices. Most interestingly, the authors found that the new star-shaped mols. are capable of coordinating to various metal centers, which results in the formation of novel coordination compds. Some of these new compds. are capable of selectively detecting specific small mols. by functioning as fluorescent sensors, an example of which, the ZnII complex of 1,3,5-tris[p-(2,2'-dipyridylamino)phenyl]benzene (TPDPB, I) is described herein. The TPDPB ligand displays a broad emission band at λmax = 386 nm in soln. (CH2Cl2) and at λmax = 400 nm in the solid state when irradiated by UV light. The quantum efficiency of TPDPB in soln. was detd. to be 0.19. relative to that of 9.10-diphenylanthracence. The star-shaped complex, [(ZnCl2)3(TPDPB)] (1) was obtained from the reaction of TPDPB with three equiv. of ZnCl2 in CH2Cl2/CH3OH soln. Complex I1 is stable toward air and moisture in soln. and in the solid state and its fluorescence emission shows an unusually high selectivity to benzene vapor.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD3MXosV2jt7w%253D&md5=7d76ff225d005d97f3fbd6cf9e93fdf3
        (b) Liang, K.; Zheng, H. G.; Song, Y. L.; Lappert, M. F.; Li, Y. Z.; Xin, X. Q.; Huang, Z. X.; Chen, J. T.; Lu, S. F. Angew. Chem., Int. Ed. 2004, 43, 5776
        [Crossref], [PubMed], [CAS], Google Scholar
        1b
        Coordination polymers: Self-assembly of interpenetrating coordination nets formed from interpenetrating cationic and anionic three-dimensional diamondoid cluster coordination polymers
        Liang, Kai; Zheng, Hegen; Song, Yinglin; Lappert, Michael E.; Li, Yizhi; Xin, Xinquan; Huang, Zixiang; Chen, Jiutong; Lu, Shaofang
        Angewandte Chemie, International Edition (2004), 43 (43), 5776-5779CODEN: ACIEF5; ISSN:1433-7851. (Wiley-VCH Verlag GmbH & Co. KGaA)
        Tetrathiometalates [WS4]2- are the nodal building blocks in a new kind of heterometallic interpenetrating three-dimensional cluster coordination polymer, {[WS4Cu4(4,4'-bipy)4][WS4Cu4I4(4,4'-bipy)2]·4H2O}n (4,4'-bipy = 4,4'-bipyridine), that has interesting nonlinear optical properties. The polymer exhibits optical self-focusing behavior and reverse saturable absorption effects.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD2cXhtVejt7%252FI&md5=6b084d9c41f657d3e4d6d5d1901c985d
        (c) Bauer, C. A.; Timofeeva, T. V.; Settersten, T. B.; Patterson, B. D.; Liu, V. H.; Simmons, B. A.; Allendorf, M. D. J. Am. Chem. Soc. 2007, 129, 7136
        [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
        1c
        Influence of Connectivity and Porosity on Ligand-Based Luminescence in Zinc Metal-Organic Frameworks
        Bauer, Christina A.; Timofeeva, Tatiana V.; Settersten, Thomas B.; Patterson, Brian D.; Liu, Vincent H.; Simmons, Blake A.; Allendorf, Mark D.
        Journal of the American Chemical Society (2007), 129 (22), 7136-7144CODEN: JACSAT; ISSN:0002-7863. (American Chemical Society)
        Applications of metal-org. frameworks (MOFs) require close correlation between their structure and function. The authors describe the prepn. and characterization of two Zn MOFs based on a flexible and emissive linker mol., stilbene, which retains its luminescence within these solid materials. Reaction of trans-4,4'-stilbenedicarboxylic acid (H2L) and zinc nitrate in DMF yielded a dense 2-dimensional network, Zn3L3(DMF)2 (1), featuring Zn in both octahedral and tetrahedral coordination environments connected by trans-stilbene links. Similar reaction in N,N-diethylformamide (DEF) at higher temps., followed by replacement of solvent in workup, resulted in a porous, 3-dimensional framework structure, Zn4OL3·(DMF)(CHCl3) (2). This framework consists of two interpenetrating cubic lattices, each featuring basic Zn carboxylate vertexes joined by trans-stilbene, analogous to the isoreticular MOF (IRMOF) series. The optical properties of both 1 and 2 correlate with the local ligand environments obsd. in the crystal structures. Steady-state and time-resolved spectroscopic measurements reveal that the stilbene linkers in the dense structure 1 exhibit a small degree of interchromophore coupling. In contrast, the stilbenoid units in 2 display very little interaction in this low-d. 3-dimensional framework, with excitation and emission spectra characteristic of monomeric stilbenes, similar to the dicarboxylic acid in dil. soln. In both cases, the rigidity of the stilbene linker increases upon coordination to the inorg. units through inhibition of torsion about the central ethylene bond, resulting in luminescent crystals with increased emission lifetimes compared to solns. of trans-stilbene. The emission spectrum of 2 depends on the nature of the incorporated solvent mols., suggesting use of this or related materials in sensor applications.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD2sXltlWlurs%253D&md5=d4fb4e7121ad3251fba2c481c1ca2c49
        (d) Allendorf, M. D.; Bauer, C. A.; Bhaktaa, R. K.; Houka, R. J. T. Chem. Soc. Rev. 2009, 38, 1330
        [Crossref], [PubMed], [CAS], Google Scholar
        1d
        Luminescent metal-organic frameworks
        Allendorf, M. D.; Bauer, C. A.; Bhakta, R. K.; Houk, R. J. T.
        Chemical Society Reviews (2009), 38 (5), 1330-1352CODEN: CSRVBR; ISSN:0306-0012. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
        A review; metal-org. frameworks (MOFs) display a wide range of luminescent behaviors resulting from the multifaceted nature of their structure. In this crit. review we discuss the origins of MOF luminosity, which include the linker, the coordinated metal ions, antenna effects, excimer and exciplex formation, and guest mols. The literature describing these effects is comprehensively surveyed, including a categorization of each report according to the type of luminescence obsd. Finally, we discuss potential applications of luminescent MOFs. This review will be of interest to researchers and synthetic chemists attempting to design luminescent MOFs, and those engaged in the extension of MOFs to applications such as chem., biol., and radiation detection, medical imaging, and electro-optical devices.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD1MXkvVamurg%253D&md5=9219edb8997dd29d5f61edbe8e99797d

        [Crossref], [PubMed], [CAS], Google Scholar
        1e
        A robust near infrared luminescent ytterbium metal-organic framework for sensing of small molecules
        Guo, Zhiyong; Xu, Hui; Su, Shengqun; Cai, Jianfeng; Dang, Song; Xiang, Shengchang; Qian, Guodong; Zhang, Hongjie; O'Keeffe, Michael; Chen, Banglin
        Chemical Communications (Cambridge, United Kingdom) (2011), 47 (19), 5551-5553CODEN: CHCOFS; ISSN:1359-7345. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
        The 1st near-IR luminescent ytterbium metal-org. framework, Yb(BPT)(H2O).(DMF)1.5(H2O)1.25 (BPT = biphenyl 3,4',5-tricarboxylate), was realized for the highly selective and sensitive sensing of small mols.

        A review. The authors discuss the title topic and applications such as LEDs and luminescent sensors.

      2. 2
        (a) Murray, L. J.; Dincâ, M.; Long, J. R. Chem. Soc. Rev. 2009, 38, 1294
        [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
        2a
        Hydrogen storage in metal-organic frameworks
        Murray, Leslie J.; Dinca, Mircea; Long, Jeffrey R.
        Chemical Society Reviews (2009), 38 (5), 1294-1314CODEN: CSRVBR; ISSN:0306-0012. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
        A review of current status of hydrogen storage within metal-org. frameworks. Microporous metal-org. frameworks, having exceptionally high surface areas and chem.-tunable structures, have recently emerged as some of the most promising candidate materials. Particular emphasis is given to the relationships between structural features and the enthalpy of hydrogen adsorption, spectroscopic methods for probing framework-H2 interactions, and strategies for improving storage capacity.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD1MXkvVamuro%253D&md5=f652ac03772753d7f80244564a80e6f0

        [Crossref], [PubMed], [CAS], Google Scholar
        2b
        A Highly Connected Porous Coordination Polymer with Unusual Channel Structure and Sorption Properties
        Zhang, Yue-Biao; Zhang, Wei-Xiong; Feng, Fei-Yue; Zhang, Jie-Peng; Chen, Xiao-Ming
        Angewandte Chemie, International Edition (2009), 48 (29), 5287-5290, S5287/1-S5287/8CODEN: ACIEF5; ISSN:1433-7851. (Wiley-VCH Verlag GmbH & Co. KGaA)
        [NiII2NiIII(μ3-OH)(pba)3(ndc)1.5]·9.5DMA·8.5H2O (I; H2ndc = naphthalene-2,6-dicarboxylic acid; Hpba = 4-pyridin-4-ylbenzoic acid) was prepd. The hydroxy-centered trinuclear Ni cluster was employed to construct a highly connected, highly sym. framework with a uninodal nine-connected topol. An array of triakis tetrahedra leads to a biporous intersecting-channel system. The sorption of small gas mols. by I was studied.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD1MXosV2hs7g%253D&md5=9c20f5d9f29f95d8a72b4a8e1040372a

        [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
        2c
        Exceptional H2 Saturation Uptake in Microporous Metal-Organic Frameworks
        Wong-Foy, Antek G.; Matzger, Adam J.; Yaghi, Omar M.
        Journal of the American Chemical Society (2006), 128 (11), 3494-3495CODEN: JACSAT; ISSN:0002-7863. (American Chemical Society)
        Satn. H2 uptake in a series of microporous metal-org. frameworks (MOFs) has been measured at 77 K. Satn. pressures vary between 25 and 80 bar across the series, with MOF-177 showing the highest uptake on a gravimetric basis (7.5 wt %) and IRMOF-20 showing the highest uptake on a volumetric basis at 34 g/L. These results demonstrate that max. H2 storage capacity in MOFs correlates well to surface area, and that feasible volumetric uptakes can be realized even in highly porous materials.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD28XhvVCjsr8%253D&md5=f6d94bff4ebfd39eedeec1e04573a2e4
        (d) Rowsell, J. L. C.; Millward, A. R.; Park, K. S.; Yaghi, O. M. J. Am. Chem. Soc. 2004, 126, 5666
        [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
        2d
        Hydrogen Sorption in Functionalized Metal-Organic Frameworks
        Rowsell, Jesse L. C.; Millward, Andrew R.; Park, Kyo Sung; Yaghi, Omar M.
        Journal of the American Chemical Society (2004), 126 (18), 5666-5667CODEN: JACSAT; ISSN:0002-7863. (American Chemical Society)
        Five porous metal-org. frameworks based on linking zinc oxide clusters with benzene-1,4-dicarboxylate, naphthalene-2,6-dicarboxylate, 4,5,9,10-tetrahydropyrene-2,7-dicarboxylate, 2,3,5,6-tetramethylbenzene-1,4-dicarboxylate, or benzene-1,3,5-tris(4-benzoate) were synthesized in gram-scale quantities to measure their hydrogen uptake properties. Hydrogen adsorption isotherms measured at 77 K show a distinct dependence of uptake on the nature of the link. At 1 atm, the materials sorb between 4.2 and 9.3 mols. of H2 per formula unit. The results imply a trend in hydrogen uptake with the no. of rings in the org. moiety.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD2cXjt1ajur0%253D&md5=e58df7476eb6721e8c16cfaf80d0932d
        (e) Herm, Z. R.; Swisher, J. A.; Smit, B.; Krishna, R.; Long, J. R. J. Am. Chem. Soc. 2011, 133, 5664
        [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
        2e
        Metal-Organic Frameworks as Adsorbents for Hydrogen Purification and Precombustion Carbon Dioxide Capture
        Herm, Zoey R.; Swisher, Joseph A.; Smit, Berend; Krishna, Rajamani; Long, Jeffrey R.
        Journal of the American Chemical Society (2011), 133 (15), 5664-5667CODEN: JACSAT; ISSN:0002-7863. (American Chemical Society)
        Selected metal-org. frameworks exhibiting representative properties - high surface area, structural flexibility, or the presence of open metal cation sites - were tested for utility in the sepn. of CO2 from H2 via pressure swing adsorption. Single-component CO2 and H2 adsorption isotherms were measured at 313 K and pressures up to 40 bar for Zn4O(BTB)2 (MOF-177, BTB3- = 1,3,5-benzenetribenzoate), Be12(OH)12(BTB)4 (Be-BTB), Co(BDP) (BDP2- = 1,4-benzenedipyrazolate), H3[(Cu4Cl)3(BTTri)8] (Cu-BTTri, BTTri3- = 1,3,5-benzenetristriazolate), and Mg2(dobdc) (dobdc4- = 1,4-dioxido-2,5-benzenedicarboxylate). Ideal adsorbed soln. theory was used to est. realistic isotherms for the 80:20 and 60:40 H2/CO2 gas mixts. relevant to H2 purifn. and precombustion CO2 capture, resp. In the former case, the results afford CO2/H2 selectivities between 2 and 860 and mixed-gas working capacities, assuming a 1. bar purge pressure, ≤8.6 mol/kg and 7.4 mol/L. In particular, metal-org. frameworks with a high concn. of exposed metal cation sites, Mg2(dobdc) and Cu-BTTri, offer significant improvements over commonly used adsorbents, indicating the promise of such materials for applications in CO2/H2 sepns.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BC3MXjvVShs70%253D&md5=bec4f213a7844d1573bef3d22b37562e
      3. 3
        (a) Johnston, L. L.; Nettleman, J. H.; Braverman, M. A.; Sposato, L. K.; Supkowski, R. M.; LaDuca, R. L. Polyhedron 2010, 29, 303
        [Crossref], [CAS], Google Scholar
        3a
        Copper benzenedicarboxylate coordination polymers incorporating a long-spanning neutral co-ligand: Effect of anion inclusion and carboxylate pendant-arm length on topology and magnetism
        Johnston, Lindsey L.; Nettleman, Joseph H.; Braverman, Maxwell A.; Sposato, Laura K.; Supkowski, Ronald M.; LaDuca, Robert L.
        Polyhedron (2010), 29 (1), 303-311CODEN: PLYHDE; ISSN:0277-5387. (Elsevier Ltd.)
        Three divalent copper coordination polymers contg. arom. dicarboxylate ligands and the long-spanning tethering imine bis(4-pyridylmethyl)piperazine (bpmp) were prepd. and structurally characterized. The length of the dicarboxylate pendant arms, carboxylate binding mode, and the inclusion of anionic components play a synergistic role in structure direction in this system. {[Cu(ipt)(bpmp)(H2O)]·5H2O}n (ipt = isophthalate, 1) displays neutral (4,4) rectangular coordination polymer grids that stack in an ABCD repeat pattern. Use of the longer pendant arm dicarboxylate 1,3-phenylenediacetate (phda) resulted in {[Cu2(phda)2(bpmp)]·H2O}n (2), a 3-dimensional network coordination polymer with primitive cubic topol. that features strongly antiferromagnetically coupled (J = -331(1) cm-1) {Cu2(CO2)4} paddlewheel units. In the presence of excess nitrate ions, {[Cu(phda)(Hbpmp)](NO3)·3H2O}n (3) was isolated instead of 2; 3 manifests cationic 2-dimensional coordination polymer layers built from weakly antiferromagnetically coupled (J = -2.43(1) cm-1) {Cu2O2} dimers linked through phda and protonated bpmp ligands. The striking difference in magnetic properties is ascribed to the equatorial-equatorial vs. axial-equatorial bridging of copper coordination spheres in 2 and 3, resp.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD1MXhs1Smt7bN&md5=415e6618ce8dd9b9cdf19ef71d1c7ae9
        (b) Pan, Z. R.; Zheng, H. G.; Wang, T. W.; Song, Y.; Li, Y. Z.; Guo, Z. J.; Batten, S. R. Inorg. Chem. 2008, 47, 9528
        [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
        3b
        Hydrothermal Synthesis, Structures, and Physical Properties of Four New Flexible Multicarboxylate Ligands-Based Compounds
        Pan, Zhaorui; Zheng, Hegen; Wang, Tianwei; Song, You; Li, Yizhi; Guo, Zijian; Batten, Stuart R.
        Inorganic Chemistry (2008), 47 (20), 9528-9536CODEN: INOCAJ; ISSN:0020-1669. (American Chemical Society)
        Four new compds. of partially or wholly deprotonated 5,5'-(1,4-phenylenebis(methylene))bis(oxy)diisophthalic acid (H4L1) and 5,5'-(1,3-phenylenebis(methylene))bis(oxy)diisophthalic acid (H4L2), {[Co(L1)0.5]·(H2O)2}n (1), {[Mn(L1)0.5]·(H2O)2}n (2), {[Cu(H2L1)](μ2-bipy)}n (bipy = 4,4'-bipyridyl) (3), and {[Zn2(L2)].H2O}n (4) were synthesized in the presence or absence of auxiliary bipy ligand. Their structures were detd. by single-crystal x-ray diffraction anal. and further characterized by elemental anal., IR spectra, and TGA. Compds. 1 and 2 are isostructural and possess three-dimensional (3D) networks. In compd. 3, multicarboxylate ligands and bipy ligands link Cu centers to generate a two-dimensional (2D) sheet structure which is further connected by intermol. hydrogen bonds to form a 3-dimensional supramol. structure. In compd. 4, the Zn centers are connected by L24- anions to generate a 3-dimensional framework. Magnetic susceptibility measurements indicate that compds. 1 and 2 exhibit antiferromagnetic coupling between adjacent Co(II) ions and Mn(II) ions. The photoluminescent properties of the free H4L1 and H4L2 ligands and compd. 4 were studied in the solid state at room temp. Both ligands and compd. 4 exhibit strong violet emissions. Compared with the fluorescent emission of the ligand, the emission of 4 is red shifted and enhanced.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD1cXhtFGntr3J&md5=78d3e89f95eab133b052beb754125dbf
        (c) Humphrey, S. M.; Wood, P. T. J. Am. Chem. Soc. 2004, 126, 13236
        [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
        3c
        Multiple Areas of Magnetic Bistability in the Topological Ferrimagnet [Co3(NC5H3(CO2)2-2,5)2(μ3-OH)2(OH2)2]
        Humphrey, Simon M.; Wood, Paul T.
        Journal of the American Chemical Society (2004), 126 (41), 13236-13237CODEN: JACSAT; ISSN:0002-7863. (American Chemical Society)
        Hydrothermal reaction of CoCl2 with the K salt of pyridine-2,3-dicarboxylic acid and excess base yields [Co3(NC5H3(CO2)2-2,5)2(μ3-OH)2(OH2)2], which has a three-dimensional structure based on hydroxide-bridged triangular chains. The magnetic behavior of this compd. shows three distinct regions of magnetic bistability.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD2cXnvVeltbg%253D&md5=70a3817821f61660ac5c84d5dfeb9b1d
        (d) Jia, Q. X.; Tian, H.; Zhang, J. Y.; Gao, E. Q. Chem.—Eur. J. 2011, 17, 1040
        [Crossref], [PubMed], [CAS], Google Scholar
        3d
        Diverse Structures and Magnetism of Cobalt(II) and Manganese(II) Compounds with Mixed Azido and Carboxylato Bridges Induced by Methylpyridinium Carboxylates
        Jia, Qin-Xiang; Tian, Hua; Zhang, Jian-Yong; Gao, En-Qing
        Chemistry--A European Journal (2011), 17 (3), 1040-1051, S1040/1-S1040/5CODEN: CEUJED; ISSN:0947-6539. (Wiley-VCH Verlag GmbH & Co. KGaA)
        Herein the authors present a systematic study of the structures and magnetic properties of six coordination compds. with mixed azide and zwitterionic carboxylate ligands, [M(N3)2(2-mpc)] (2-mpc = N-methylpyridinium-2-carboxylate; M = Co for 1 and Mn for 2), [M(N3)2(4-mpc)] (4-mpc = N-methylpyridinium-4-carboxylate; M = Co for 3 and Mn for 4), [Co3(N3)6(3-mpc)2(MeOH)2] (5), and [Mn3(N3)6(3-mpc)2] (6; 3-mpc = N-methylpyridinium-3-carboxylate). Compds. 1-3 consist of 1-dimensional uniform chains with (μ-EO-N3)2(μ-COO) triple bridges (EO = end-on); 5 is also a chain compd. but with alternating [(μ-EO-N3)2(μ-COO)] triple and [(EO-N3)2] double bridges; Compd. 4 contains two-dimensional layers with alternating [(μ-EO-N3)2(μ-COO)] triple, [(μ-EO-N3)(μ-COO)] double, and (EE-N3) single bridges (EE=end-to-end); 6 is a layer compd. in which chains similar to those in 5 are cross-linked by a μ3-1,1,3-N3 azido group. Magnetically, the three CoII compds. (1, 3, and 5) all exhibit intrachain ferromagnetic interactions but show distinct bulk properties: 1 displays relaxation dynamics at very low temp., 3 is an antiferromagnet with field-induced metamagnetism due to weak antiferromagnetic interchain interactions, and 5 behaves as a noninnocent single-chain magnet influenced by weak antiferromagnetic interchain interactions. The magnetic differences can be related to the interchain interactions through π-π stacking influenced by different substitution positions in the ligands and/or different magnitudes of intrachain coupling. All of the MnII compds. show overall intrachain/intralayer antiferromagnetic interactions. Compd. 2 shows the usual 1-dimensional antiferromagnetism, whereas 4 and 6 exhibit different weak ferromagnetism due to spin canting <13.8 and 4.6 K, resp.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BC3MXmtFCjtQ%253D%253D&md5=110ef091b83e9d7b6b767869be1cd600
        (e) Zhang, X. M.; Wang, Y. Q.; Wang, K.; Gao, E. Q.; Liu, C. M. Chem. Commun. 2011, 1815
        [Crossref], [PubMed], [CAS], Google Scholar
        3e
        Metamagnetism and slow magnetic dynamics in an antiferromagnet composed of cobalt(II) chains with mixed azide-carboxylate bridges
        Zhang, Xiu-Mei; Wang, Yan-Qin; Wang, Kun; Gao, En-Qing; Liu, Cai-Ming
        Chemical Communications (Cambridge, United Kingdom) (2011), 47 (6), 1815-1817CODEN: CHCOFS; ISSN:1359-7345. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
        A novel 2-dimensional metamagnetic compd. composed of ferromagnetic Co(II) chains exhibits the intrinsic slow dynamics of single-chain magnets in the antiferromagnetic ordered phase and in the field-induced ferromagnetic phase.

        4a
        Engineering homochiral metal-organic frameworks for heterogeneous asymmetric catalysis and enantioselective separation
        Liu, Yan; Xuan, Weimin; Cui, Yong
        Advanced Materials (Weinheim, Germany) (2010), 22 (37), 4112-4135CODEN: ADVMEW; ISSN:0935-9648. (Wiley-VCH Verlag GmbH & Co. KGaA)
        A review. Owing to the potential applications in technol. areas such as gas storage, catalysis, sepn., sensing and nonlinear optics, tremendous efforts were devoted to the development of porous metal-org. frameworks (MOFs) over the past ten years. Homochiral porous MOFs are particularly attractive candidates as heterogeneous asym. catalysts and enantioselective adsorbents and separators for prodn. of optically active org. compds. due to the lack of homochiral inorg. porous materials such as zeolites. In this review, the authors summarize the recent research progress in homochiral MOF materials, including their synthetic strategy, distinctive structural features and latest advances in asym. heterogeneous catalysis and enantioselective sepn.
        >> More from SciFinder ®

        4b
        Preparation, Structures, and Photocatalytic Properties of Three New Uranyl-Organic Assembly Compounds
        Liao, Zuo-Lei; Li, Guo-Dong; Bi, Ming-Hui; Chen, Jie-Sheng
        Inorganic Chemistry (Washington, DC, United States) (2008), 47 (11), 4844-4853CODEN: INOCAJ; ISSN:0020-1669. (American Chemical Society)
        Three new uranyl-org. coordination polymers [(UO2)8(NDC)12](4,4'-bipyH2)3(4,4'-bipyH)2(4,4'-bipy) (1), (UO2)3O[Ag(2,2'-bipy)2]2(NDC)3 (2), and (UO2)2(NDC)2(2,2'-bipy)2 (3), where NDC = 1,4-naphthalenedicarboxylate and bipy = bipyridine, were prepd. in hydrothermal conditions. Both 1 and 2 possess a 2-dimensional structure while 3 is composed of 1-dimensional zigzag chains. In 1 there are mononuclear pentagonal-bipyramidal U-O polyhedra and 1-dimensional channels filled with 4,4'-bipy mols., whereas in 2 there are mononuclear hexagonal-bipyramidal U-O polyhedra and tetranuclear pentagonal-bipyramidal U-O clusters which form 2-dimensional channels with occluded [Ag(2,2'-bipy)2]+ counterions. In 3 both the NDC and the bipy ligands coordinate to uranyl centers, leading to hexagonal-bipyramidal polyhedra which are connected to form 1-dimensional zigzag chains. Under UV or visible irradn., 1 and 2 degrade rhodamine B with similar efficiency. The correlation between photocatalytic reaction rate and O2 concn. for 1 and 2 also was elucidated. Crystal data: 1, triclinic, space group P‾1, a 11.037(2), b 15.126(3), c 15.660(3) Å, α 62.05(3), β 72.26(3), γ 82.05(3)°, and Z = 2; 2, triclinic, space group P‾1, a 14.161(3), b 15.122(3), c 18.212(4) Å, α 85.73(3), β 76.99(3), γ 67.32(3)°, and Z = 2; 3, monoclinic, space group P21/n, a 10.7976(18), b 31.501(6), c 11.590(2) Å, β 97.609(4)°, and Z = 4.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD1cXlt1Sltbs%253D&md5=51982473ed0008113ef7ea2289c23742
        (c) Chen, W.; Zhang, Y. Y.; Zhu, L. B.; Lan, J. B.; Xie, R. G.; You, J. S. J. Am. Chem. Soc. 2007, 129, 13879
        [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
        4c
        A Concept of Supported Amino Acid Ionic Liquids and Their Application in Metal Scavenging and Heterogeneous Catalysis
        Chen, Wen; Zhang, Yuanyuan; Zhu, Liangbo; Lan, Jingbo; Xie, Rugang; You, Jingsong
        Journal of the American Chemical Society (2007), 129 (45), 13879-13886CODEN: JACSAT; ISSN:0002-7863. (American Chemical Society)
        Supported ionic liqs. are prepd. by polymn. of vinylbenzylimidazolium chlorides, ion exchange with sodium hydroxide, and neutralization and counterion exchange with L-proline; the supported ionic liqs. are effective scavenging agents for copper, palladium, and iridium, and act as recyclable catalysts for copper-catalyzed coupling of aryl bromides and chlorides with nitrogen heterocycles and for the palladium-catalyzed solvent-free hydrogenation of styrene to ethylbenzene. Copper iodide-catalyzed N-arylation of nitrogen heterocycles with aryl and heteroaryl bromides and chlorides in the presence of a polymer-supported imidazolium L-prolinate gives arylated nitrogen heterocycles in higher yields than the corresponding reactions under either homogeneous conditions or in the presence of an ionic liq. and L-proline. A copper-complexed polymer-supported imidazolium L-prolinate ionic liq. catalyst is recycled and used in ten repetitions of the coupling reaction of imidazole with 4-bromobenzonitrile to give 4-(1-imidazolyl)benzonitrile, with the yield decreasing from 95% in the first reaction to 73% in the tenth reaction; the activity of the catalyst decreases when the pH of the reaction medium is either less than 6 or greater than 10. Reaction of a polymer-supported imidazolium L-prolinate ionic liq. and palladium acetate generates an effective catalyst for the solvent-free hydrogenation of styrene.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD2sXhtFKksL3P&md5=9539dea6cfb9c9c9d35029349406253b
        (e) Dang, D.; Wu, P.; He, C.; Xie, Z.; Duan, C. J. Am. Chem. Soc. 2010, 132, 14321

        4e
        Homochiral Metal-Organic Frameworks for Heterogeneous Asymmetric Catalysis
        Dang, Dongbin; Wu, Pengyan; He, Cheng; Xie, Zhong; Duan, Chunying
        Journal of the American Chemical Society (2010), 132 (41), 14321-14323CODEN: JACSAT; ISSN:0002-7863. (American Chemical Society)
        Homochiral crystns. of two enantiomeric metal-org. frameworks (MOFs) Ce-MDIP1 and Ce-MDIP2 were achieved by using L- or D-BCIP [N-t-butoxycarbonyl-2-(imidazole)-1-pyrrolidine] as chiral inductions, resp., where the chiralities were characterized by solid state CD spectra. Ce-MDIPs exhibit excellent catalytic activity and high enantioselectivity for the asym. cyanosilylation of arom. aldehydes; the homochiral Cd-TBT [TBT = 1,3,5-tris(4-carboxyphenyl)benzene] MOF having L-PYI [ 1-(L-pyrrolidin-2-ylmethyl)-1H-imidazole] as a chiral adduct exhibits stereochem. catalysis toward the Aldol reactions.

        5a
        Cation-dependent nonlinear optical behavior in an octupolar three dimensional anionic metal-organic open framework
        Liu, Yan; Li, Gao; Li, Xing; Cui, Yong
        Angewandte Chemie, International Edition (2007), 46 (33), 6301-6304CODEN: ACIEF5; ISSN:1433-7851. (Wiley-VCH Verlag GmbH & Co. KGaA)
        A holey host: an octupolar porous metalorg. framework with a Td-sym. supercage structure; exhibits a powder second harmonic generation (SHG) intensity about 15 times higher than that of KH2PO4. This anionic open framework is highly thermally stable, displays high ion-exchange capacities with the cations NH4+, Na+, and K+, and, more importantly, exhibits an unprecedented cation-dependent NLO activity.

        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD2sXpvVSltL0%253D&md5=526694f37b6a4e1e151680f8fc2fc64c
